column4: ummmm, I did sudo apt-get update then sudo apt-get upgrade and I have to get 1400 MBs of updates??
whens the last time you upgraded?
and how many packages do you have installed?
open synaptic and look at the status bar
i think that you'll be fine, though you can look at changelogs with the update-manager
and one more question, I want to upgrade to hardy, and doing sudo do-release-upgrade in terminal tells me I need to dl around 2200 MBs of updates, so are those ~1400 MB updates included in those???
i think so. be sure to use the -m desktop switch though
oh, thanks I haven't included that
sorry, but when I do sudo do-release-upgrade -m i get: "do-release-upgrade: error: -m option requires an argument
I get: The generated cache was invalid.
